description:
One of the best gyro wraps iv had in the city. Unassuming little spot that I figured just served a variety of your standard wraps but I was instead pleasently surprised to learn is a mediterranean specialty restaurant. 

I ordered the meat lovers wrap which subs the veggies besides onions for tons of lamb meat along with spicy sauce and tzatziki sauce. The guy at the counter was friendly and helpful and service was super fast. He even walked it out to me rather then just call me back to the counter which was nice.

This wrap was as wide and long as my forearm and packed with meat! It was slightly more pricy then whats listed on yelp but a good value considering how much food and lamb meat it was. I opted for medium spicy and it came out just right. Not too hot to handle but flavorful. The lavash wrap was thin and crisp and held up under the weight of all the filling.

All around a good experience. They had free samples of fresh snickerdoodle cookies too that were really good so ill have to come back again sometime.
author: Sean G.

description:
I ordered the shawarma wrap, and it was surprisingly really good! I came in after a night of drinking for some grub and I thought I ordered a shawarma but I got a wrap (duh lol), but the tortilla wrap was fresh and flaky. I can tell they make the tortilla in house. They also specialize in fresh baked cookies! They had samples on the display case...and after one small bite I was sold on a whole cookie (I'm not one for sweets). 

It's definitely a late night spot, or lunch spot. They have a couple 2-tops and one 4, and about 4 bar seating. I'd come here with a group no bigger than 6, or literally alone because it's good. Their service is also really friendly and accommodating. It's in the fidi so parking is poop, and public transit is good.

I'd definitely come here again to try one of their other wraps, and get another chocolate chip cookie!
author: Navila H.

description:
I went here for a quick lunch. The only meat halal here is the gyro meat that's mixed with lamb and beef. I got the gyro with the halal lamb and beef with added avocado. Gyro meat was delicious not overly oiled up and meat pieces were huge. Wish the chicken was halal 

Service was friendly, their cookies are bomb as well!

I will be back.
author: Shabnam N.

description:
The service was fast and friendly. They had me pay after I eat which was heart warming and speaks of their trust. The food was fresh and meat was well cooked.
Thank you
author: Fatima S.

description: Good food that's open late! The staff are nice and really accommodating considering the late night crowd might be a little rowdy! Ask for hot sauce!
author: Haley M.

description:
While on a weekend road trip with my folks we were looking for healthy eats in the SF Financial District. We had already exhausted sub.way on our trip so that was out of the question. SF Wraps was also one of the only eateries open on the weekend on within a few blocks of were staying.  

Parking is limited to street parking or city parking structures.

Location easy to find on Kearny not far from the China.town gate.

Exterior is simple and had a small set of tables & chairs outside.

Interior is small but inviting wood furniture.

Staff was friendly and professional.

Food was delicious. The baba ganoush came out first and my folks and I enjoyed it. The avocado wraps took a little bit longer but were scrumptious. They were rather large so we ate half and ended up saving the rest for later. My folks and I still talk about the SF Avocado wraps! 

WC is shared with other businesses and tucked away in the back.
author: Susy B.

description: Basic Greek food at a reasonable price. Well displayed choices on LCDs. Friendly cook and owner.
author: Zapotal A.

description: Not bad, can't beat there hours. San Francisco needs more late night early am healthy eating spots.
author: Peter T.

description:
I appreciate the consistency and the late hours!
Thank you SF Wraps for being open so late!
author: Essi A.

description: The owners are extremely kind and welcoming. They have AMAZING fresh-baked cookies!!!! the hummus was really good and they gave a generous portion. The service was stellar and I can't recommend this place enough. I had the gyro and hummus and my friend got a shawarma wrap. Everything was really tasty and the ingredients were fresh. I would strongly recommend this place and I will definitely be coming back!
author: Nisreen A.

description:
I come here all the time, to the point where all the cashiers on their weekly rotation recognize me.

As a diabetic, I love this place. Open all the time. Service is very fast. Get the chicken or lamb/beef gyro plates, they are absolutely delicious. For their plates, they give a very generous helping of chicken or gyro, and the hummus and tzatziki complement the meat very well. Salads are crisp and fresh. Make sure to ask for hot sauce with your order (which I think is Huy Fong Foods' Chili Garlic Sauce).

One thing to note: I think they set lower prices on the weekends. So definitely stop by if you're around on a Saturday or Sunday!
author: Jason T.

description: Tried this place for the first time and they had the best customer service. The shawarma wrap was so good! Thank you
author: Justin C.

description: I happened to be in the area on Saturday evening and decided to give this place a try. I ordered the gyro plate and was really impressed with the freshness and quality of ingredients .The girl at the counter was efficient and professional. The place is very clean and looks recently remodeled. I will be back for sure..
author: George B.

description:
Not impressed.  What kind of Mediterranean restaurant runs out of feta?? That totally messed with what I wanted to order.  I ended up getting the chicken salad and a side of rice to go.  The chicken on the chicken salad was good, but came in 4 giant pieces and they didn't have plastic knives.  But luckily they gave me two forks so I could rip the chicken up myself.  Would it take them too long to cut it for you?  Anyway, overall I didn't like the salad.  It came with the smallest side of congealed dressing and there was a weirdly large amount of cabbage in the mixed greens.  Didn't realize I was ordering a raw cabbage salad.  The side of rice was extremely bland.  There's a previous review about the rice not coming with "carrots, onions, and spices" and the owner responded saying they didn't update the menu.  Well, the menu still says "carrots, onions, and spices" and I just got rice and some carrots.  

Also, a to go salad place should ask customers if they want their dressing mixed in or on the side.  I'm just going to keep going to Working Girls next door.
author: Jessica F.

description:
This place makes stuff super fresh (great greens) and the owner is super friendly- usually makes a point to remember who you are and ask how you're doing. The place has been in business for a long time, and has a bunch of low key charm. 

Great for lunch, or a quick after work/late night bite.

P.s the cookies are insanely good. I don't know what he does to them haha
author: Jj B.

description:
Food 2/5. Service 4/5. Ambiance 2/5.

We stopped by here for a quick lunch and it was just that. It wasn't the best chicken shawarma wrap. nor was it a the worst. There was only one person working the counter and cook, but the food didn't take that long. 

It's a little shop, a wall in the hole, with a few tables. I got the chicken shawarma with chicken breast, cucumber, spring mix, red onion, hummus and tahini. The person working the counter also asks if you want it spicy or not but it wasn't that spicy. The chicken in the wrap is somewhat dry and even the hummus and tahini doesn't hide that fact. The wrap they use seems like the premade ones that you buy in bulk. The combination of ingredients made it just an alright wrap. 

Overall, it's an okay place to stop for a quick lunch but it isn't great. 

Tips - Don't order anything with chicken breast it's kinda dry. 

Pros - quick and fast. 

Cons - precooked chicken just didn't make it a great experience.
author: Brian N.

description:
I ordered the vegan falafel and it absolutely tasted terrible! Trust me, I am no five star food critic but if you like extremely bitter food that sets you on the verge of throwing up, you're at the right spot.

I didn't know if it was supposed to taste the way it did or if it was just an off day, but the quality was just unacceptable. Another review mentioned the falafel tasting like baking soda and I honestly think that was the best description of it. It looked like it was worth the price because of the size, but please don't be deceived by the inconsistent quality of their food. 

Really let down by the fact that other customers loved their food. So upset that I spent $12 on this meal only to throw it away :( Hopefully I get a refund or something because that was pricey!!!!
author: Danielle P.

description: I placed a phone order to pick up. The guy had alright service, didn't mention the price but asked how far I was so he could make sure it was warm. I Was not satisfied especially since I paid 13$ for just a falafel wrap. I try to eat as plant based as possible so falafels are my go to. The texture of the falafel is not how it should be   They were almost like doughy and dry. The wrap itself was cold. I asked for spicy And it didn't have their spicy sauce. I know they have that red sauce. I'm not sure what was going on in there but when I arrived it wasn't busy at all. (Btw this was around midnight.) so i don't understand how hard it is to put that sauce. Who knows. But if you want tasty falafels. Try oasis grill but they close earlier. That is all :/
author: Christian E.

description: The chicken shawarma wrap here is SO good! The staff is also really friendly here. I would definitely come here again.
author: Amanda A.

description: We stumbled along this place because most other places in the area were closed or too busy due to Bastille day. I ordered the chicken gyro with the add on of avocado. The chicken was a delicious mixture of white and dark meat and the rest was packed with fresh veggies. I would order again. The hubby ordered a standard lamb gyro wrap, this was also delicious. Only issue was we had to wait a small bit to get the wraps, but they were worth the wait.
author: A K.

description: I tried the chicken gyro and it was pretty good. They didn't have a beef-only option because it is pre-mixed with lamb. They were very friendly and offered a piece of lamb as a sample which was pretty good. The service is fast and friendly and prices are pretty good for SF.
author: Aram S.

description: I've been on a hunt for best gyro in sf, thus far these guys win. Spicy gyro was on point, only complaint is I wish they had it on big puffy pita instead of lavash. Spicy was perfect
author: Morgan M.

description:
I'm not sure what's with the recent bad reviews, but I just had a great experience here. I ordered the Spicy Gyro, and it was quite tasty. It was also ready in about five minutes. 

If I had to dig deep for an area of opportunity, I would say to slice the cucumbers thinner so that they don't breach the wrap. That's a pretty minor issue. 

"I'll be back" - Arnold Schwarzenegger
author: Ben L.

description:
I wish there was an option for negative rating. The food is HORRIBLE and the staff is worse. I think they charge to even Smile.
Such awful food...no taste, the gyro bread was stale (P.S--someone needs to tell them what gyro bread looks like). 

I am usually very good with picking good food places....This clearly was one of few worst places I've ever been to.
author: Nidhi M.

description: Love their Gyro sandwiches which are at reasonable price.  I also like their cookies which they make themselves and taste home made.  They are open very late on Friday and Saturday nights which is convenient when everything else is closed.  Not fancy but great tasting.
author: Tom K.

description:
Listen, I wanted to love this place. Middle Eastern next to my Arabic class, what's not to love. But I was in a hurry, needed a pre-class snack, ordered the rice. 
Menu said "carrots, onions, spices, oil." Price was $6+.
What I got was rice. Yellow rice. With oil. 

Photo attached. There were orange SPECKS in the rice. I imagine that's what they meant by carrots. I'm not exaggerating, they were specks. If put all together, they would probably make for one-fourth of an inch of carrot. There wasn't even salt. Oh, and no onions. None that I could see or taste anyway. 

I don't care how good the other dishes are. Anyone that serves what I was served, given the description of the dish and price, should just shut shop and go home. Like, why bother?
author: C J.

description: This is THE place to go in San Fransisco for the best wraps in the Bay area! We were visiting for 7 days and tried Vegan dishes all over the city. We kept coming back virtually every day for their perfectly garnished & plentiful spicy falafel and spicy avocado wraps. We also kept coming back for the absolutely incredible friendly and personable service. It wasn't a day in the city until we got to say hello to Jim & Nima. Don't miss out on this place!
author: Roger B.

description:
Complete shot-in-the-dark pick for lunch on a Monday afternoon.  We were pressed for time, and my friend wanted to go to a sandwich shop nearby, but it was packed and had no seating.  This was definitely a worthy substitute.

For just under $12, you can get a plate, which consists of a huge portion of meat, Greek salad, hummus, and tzatziki.  They also have wraps for $8-10 (don't remember the exact amount).  It's very typical of other fast casual Greek restaurants I've been to -- you order at the front, sit down with a number, and they bring it to you in a basket in a flash.  I got the Gyro Plate, which was lamb and beef, but the Chicken Plate looked really tasty as well!  Each plate comes with a side of pita squares, which is different from the pita pockets or little wedges that I normally see.  I actually like these more -- they're like a deck of cards and you can make little sandwiches out of them.  Other fast-casual Greek places, take note.

Very good, fairly quick lunch option, and a lot of food for a fair price.  It's worth checking out.
author: Alex L.

description:
Anywhere there is booze, there inevitably is booze food nearby. Hot dog carts, burritos, you name it - some place will be open late, with good and greasy food for cheap. This is that place for this area. 

Come here at normal dinnertime, and you'll find it surprisingly bar rent. But come back at 1am and you'll find it a bustling enterprise, full of happy but a little derpy people.

Is this a great wrap? Absolutely. But is it AMAZING when you're drunk at 2AM? Even moreso. 

Affordable, open late, and great taste. What more is there to tell? Seating is limited, but that's been okay anyone I've been here.
author: Chris S.

description:
Remember the post-credits ending of "The Avengers"? Yeah, as the superheroes were all sitting around a table as they all tried the shawarmas. You couldn't quite tell whether they were exhausted from the battle against the Chitauri to save the planet or they just weren't into the shawarmas. After trying SF Wraps, I tend to think the latter since there are few things more disappointing than a marginal shawarma at lunch. At least that's what happened to me when I came in here in a hurry before heading back into the office. Now this used to be California Golden Cookies, but even though the cookies are still for sale, the purveyors finally switched the name to something more accurate about their menu.

They offer the standard Greek options like spanakopita, hummus, falafels, gyros and ah yes, wraps. The name change hasn't done anything to improve the quality of the food here though. I ordered the supposedly fool-proof $8.45 Shawarma Wrap, which was a somewhat crusty piece of lavash slathered with hummus and tahini sauce and rolled around shards of beef and lamb gyros, cucumber, tomatoes, lettuce and chopped red onions (photo: http://bit.ly/1Sw4fLK). It just tasted off, really off, with the meat having that unmistakable consistency of post-freezer burn. I ate a third of it but no more. Now I know how Iron Man feels. The cookies still looked good, and truth be told, that's what most of the incoming customers appeared to be seeking. Maybe they should have just kept the name.

FOOD - 2 stars...a disappointing shawarma is like a motherless child
AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...same tight spot as before, nothing's changed so grab a table if you must
SERVICE - 2.5 stars...order at the counter, that's it
TOTAL - 2 stars...I think you'll have better luck at Ayola
author: Ed U.

description: Ordered the gyro wrap with spicy option. Did not disappoint. The wrap was larger than I expected and filled me up. They are super focused on cleanliness. I went to shake their hand to say thank you and he said he touched money and didn't want to contaminate my hand. Elbow bump sufficed.
author: Michael C.

description:
This was an accidental find as I was walking around looking for some grub. The small shop was inviting with someone ordering and 4 patrons sitting down at the 8 spaces available for seating. 

The owner (I'm guessing) took my order with a smile and friendly conversation. While I was waiting on my food, one of the female patrons had leftovers and the owner asked if she needed a bag. He bagged it for her. Amazing service!

The menu is simply appetizers, soups and salads, wraps, and plates. They also have some cookies and baklava. 

I got the chicken gyro plate which comes with a salad. It was good, not great, but lots of meat with plenty of sauce.

Try them out!
author: Rick G.

description:
Ok.  Let me be clear.  This was the ONLY place open in the area that wasn't questionable Chinese food.  So we walked in while we were having a grump between the wife and I.  It was super late and I just needed to make sure I got something to eat before going to bed.

We walked in and the guy was cleaning up.  It was a holiday weekend so I wasn't sure if we were coming in after they had closed.  But he was insistent that everything was fine.  I ordered some falafel and my wife ordered a huge wrap.  Both were pretty good.  I'm glad I didn't order a wrap for myself because I wasn't that hungry, but if I had been this would have been plenty of food.  It wasn't bad either.  The gyro meat was ok.  The falafel was a little spongy and even though it was edible I wouldn't get that again.

We were in and out in less than 10 minutes.  There is no real parking nearby, but if you dropped someone off and rounded the block a few times it probably would work out just fine.
author: Robert S.

description:
I got the turkey breast wrap and subbed the mayo & mustard for hummus. It was pretty good except the fact the turkey was cubed and tasted very plastic/chewy?? It was also very salty. Everything else include the lavash wrap, veggies & hummus tasted good though! My boyfriend got the grilled chicken wrap & it was soooo much better. 

The guy who took our order was also very nice because we made several modifications to our orders. The order was made very quickly & the wraps were pretty large & filling! HOWEVER, I saw the worker in the back who made our sandwiches not use any gloves while assembling our wrap..... it's food service. Gloves are necessary whenever you make food. Kinda disgusting now that I think of it. I didn't get sick though so I'm glad but this place is more on the lower end if you want greek food. There's other better places!
author: Winnie L.

description:
One of the best falafel wraps in town.. falafel's texture was perfect, I'd definitely be returning here. I also tried the baklavas, they were good !!

After sleeping for 2 days because I was sick; I went there late at nite towards closing time, yet I received A1 customer service..
author: Ale B.

description:
My friends and I came here for drunchies only because it was the only place open late nearby.  I dont know about you but I don't usually eat gyros as drunchies but being that it was so cold, we didn't want to keep walking around so we settled with SF Wraps.

Honestly food is supposed to taste 10x better when you're drunk but this place was still just OK for me.  I thought the food was a little disappointing in my opinion as I saw the solid 4 star rating, I had higher expectations.  My boyfriend and I shared the Combo Wrap and it was HUGE for the price of only $9?  However, there was something off about the meat; it just didn't taste right/had an off after-taste.  A few of my friends said the same thing while the other few enjoyed their meal.  What I did like was the spring mix, good amount of veggies and the sauce they used for the wraps.
author: Regina O.

description: Came here late at night because it was the only place open around me. Got the combo plate. It was sub par food and way overpriced - but it did satisfy.
author: AK _.

description: Glad to know there is a gyro place in sf that is open late. Great food to get after a night out. Been here a few times, and have always enjoyed the food.
author: Shanzay H.

description: SF Wraps is unassuming, but the wraps are delicious and the cookies are spectacular. They stay open at many times when everything else is closed (like Sunday night).  Fast & delicious; a hidden gem if tasty Gyro delicious nesd. Give them a try.
author: Mark B.

description: Passed this place on our way down to the Beat museum.  Its a small storefront however the food is fresh and delicious.  I had a falafel wrap and it was filled with perfectly fried balls of chickpea heaven.  It was stuffed full of fresh veggies and slathered with their delicious hummus.  What a treat.  My husband had the gyro and it too was filled with delicious goodness of flavorful chunks of lamb.  The owner recommended the spicy sauce on the side and we are glad we tried it.  Thig gyro is different than the usual.  It is wrapped in lavosh bread and the meat is not cut from the big rack of rotating meat but so good nevertheless and not greasy.  Dont forget to have a homemade cookie hot and fresh from their ovens!!
author: Pepper H.

description: Owner could not be nicer. Food could not be better. I always keep this place in mind when in SF and craving a gyro. I appreciate the freshness of the veggies and the fact the owner remembers everyone and is so kind and friendly. Great place to grab a quick to-go shawarma.
author: Marie F.

description: I will never step foot in or around this restaurant.. we are here today and the lady behind the counter was not only rude but had no customer service skills. After they "microwaved" our wraps she comes out with a bland tortilla that was not completely wrapped so all the vegetables and the little amount of meat fell out. When I approached the lady she said too bad and as I continued to eat I noticed the little meat that they offered inside was undercooked and it was like chewing rubber. I would avoid this place as my wife still has stomach pains from this place. The wraps are over priced and there are way too many choices including chipotles that is a better bet and quality. They got me for over $65 for 5 undercooked wraps.
author: VANESSA J.

description: Stopped in here on a Saturday and had the chicken Shawarma with avocado. Really fresh and healthy tasting, not an old school Shawarma, a bit more gourmet tasting. Would definitely come back.
author: Peter C.

description: Charming place - homemade, fresh and authentic. The cookies and desserts are quite good too. The owners are nice and helpful!
author: Philip W.

description: When everything is closed at 10 PM this spot does the job! Delicious, affordable, and keeps the night going. Even has fresh baked cookies for that sweet fix. Definitely worth a stop.
author: Sako K.

description: Great people and love the food. I'm not a hummus person but love there hummus!!  Love the meat lover wrap and plates!!
author: Aaron W.

description: This is what you exactly expect from Mediterranean food. Healthy, not greasy and yummy. I got Gyro with rice, u can try it if you like meat. I'm also a big fan of their cookies which are very tasteful and moderately sweet. Try them they are just 2.75 per each. I like peanut butter and milk chocolate flavor.
author: Mina K.

description: Amazing Greek food, love this small spot! Don't let the location fool you. The service is excellent and the staff is always very very nice. Avoid the Green Olive SF, this is WAY better, and WAY less salty.
author: Ian C.

description:
Usually this place is great!

But the last three times I've ordered from here and taken away- they have given me the wrong order or messed up my order- I recommend to start double checking your order before you leave
author: Kristin J.

description:
Hole in the wall with great food. I had the rice plate, and was happy to taste they had seasoned their meat nicely. The rice was also tasty, and not dry. I'm a big fan of hummus, and that is included in the plate. 
There's a few other menu items I'd try, and if they're as good as this plate was, I'll happily recommend to anyone.
author: Melissa S.

description:
The food is great, there is a balanced mixture of spices and well marinated meat and chicken. Exactly the kind of taste you expect from a Mediterranean  or Middle Eastern food. The staff are super friendly and the place is clean. One of the best restaurants you find with this price in SF. 
Make sure you try the cookies
author: Siavash J.

description:
Doesn't look much from the outside but sometimes you have to give these places a try and for my first meal in SF, it was exactly what I needed! Meat, sauce and wrap - quick, large and good quality. NOM. 

I opted for the chicken meat love with extra rice and a bottle of water. Chicken was warm and fresh, and wrap HUGE! I could only eat half and had to take the rest home! It cost $14.95 - which for the size I thought was pretty good (although still getting used to the exchange rates!) 

Thumbs up from me!
author: Bethany W.

description:
What a great little place in the heart of the city
We were so happy that they were open on Christmas Day, me and my buddy both had the most delicious shawarma wraps ever and we were greeted with such a pleasant smile, highly recommend this family run wrap place
author: SASAN S.

description: As I walked by the restaurant today the smell was so good I knew it would be a disservice to myself not to stop for a quick bite. Ordering the spicy shawarma was an excellent choice. Perfectly cooked, fresh ingredients, with delicious hummus and sauce. Would recommend and will return.
author: Eric J.

description: Not very good, the chicken was bland with little flavor. I would recommend another gyro place.
author: Bob B.

description:
Surprisingly enough it's very tough to find a place to grab dinner around the Financial District -- perhaps all the executives ain't working on weekends, who knows? 
Three people in our group wanted a kebab so we start searching for one that was close to the hotel and nice. 

SF Wraps has a small store with a few tables to sit and eat. I ordered the Shawarma without changing anything. It took us about 5 minutes to get the order, which I think was pretty fast. \
Wrap was good but the meat did not taste like shawarma at all. I was not expecting an authentic turkish meal, but did get a little disappointed. I think prices were high, if you think this is a "fast food" place, but the portions are quite big. They are open until very late at night so it's perfect to grab some after hours, drunken snacks.
author: Fernanda S.

description:
Negative stars if I could. Walked in on Christmas Eve desperate for food and nothing else was open I walked in with my dude, looked at the menu and ordered quickly (their menu options aren't much options). 

Ordered Togo, opened the wrap in the car as we were driving and was disgusted. 

I paid $22.50 in cash for my "vegan" BURRITO and his chicken shawarma BURRITO. 

It was as long as his forearm but mine was bland AF, no flavor at all. 

Lettuce tomato, avocado, red onion hummus rice +$1.00
Same for his but with chicken. 

We forced ourselves to eat it, + $20 is too much for burritos with no flavor.

I guess if u like this stuff go for it
author: Charlie W.

description:
I thank my lovely ladies, Yelp app and the great bars that got me tipsy in order to be able to find this place. The lovely ladies and I were bar hopping near the financial district/ Broadway area and after leaving the bar we decided to stop and get something to eat so we can bring our drinking high down. We noticed SF Wraps, not because of its looks but because it smelled SO DAMN GOOD from a mile away and plus it's open really late! LITERALLY! We followed our nose and decided to give it a try after we seem tons of people walking out of here with BIG ol wraps in there hand!

I walked in and was greeted my Reza who is the owner very nice pleasant man. I stated to him that it was my first time and after looking at the menu I was kind of overwhelmed by all the different food options. All I knew was that I wanted whatever the other people had that smelled so delicious! Reza stated to me that many people order the Gyro Wrap.

The food is LEGIT here! The cooks name is Pablo and let me just say, "He knows how to get down in the kitchen". The food is tasty, flavorful and the portions are nice and you will leave you full. I still can't believe I was able to take down a whole wrap but I guess that's what happens when you are tipsy and hungry! Not only are the wraps a huge portion but the salads...OMG!! They looked so dang good and there huge! You have to order one to see for yourself. The have many good options of food but I really recommend the Wraps!  

Seating area is small inside with a couple of tables and chairs so don't be alarmed but the food will make it all worth it!

I never even knew this place existed and I am so thankful I found this! I can now eat healthy late at night when in the SF area and I don't have to feel guilty! I know where to come to now and with the great customer service from Reza there is NO WAY I am second guessing myself when in the area!

I will be back Reza and SF Wraps!
author: Porsche C.

description:
Good food, polite service, and a clean, bright, simple setting.

My husband and I shared a standard Shawarma wrap - they're a good size, and we had just come from an event with drinks and appetizers, so half a wrap was just right!  It was flavorful.

The service was polite, and they offered to cut the wrap in half for us, which we really appreciated. And then it showed up in two plates - fantastic! 

There's limited seating, but the place is clean, bright, and inviting.

Overall, a good spot for a quick bite!
author: Barnali D.

description: So good!  Came here totally by accident.  We were aiming for sandwiches next door, but there was no outdoor seating for pups.  Let me just say, I LOVE mediterranean food, and both the quality and portion sizes here are impressive.  The falafel didn't seem fried/crispy like other places, but it was WAY tastier.  Gyro, baba ghanoush, dolma, if you just order a single appetizer of those, they give you way more than enough for one person.  Way more generous and tasty than any place I've been to in LA!
author: Cindy L.

description:
Thank the whiskey & beer gods for SF Wraps because they are ideally located across the street from Rickhouse and they are open just as late.  Not only that but their prices are fair, the portions huge and food delicious.  It is truly a saving grace when you and your friends are on a long night of walking, brewery and bar crawling on a Saturday night.

Knowing very well that I was going to be starving after a night of miles of walking, beer & whiskey drinking, it was comforting to know that there was a place nearby that was open late that served up some solid food options.

A friend and I came here after leaving Rickhouse.  I forget what my friend ordered but I got a Beef Shawarma Wrap ($8-$9) and an order of Falafel.  The Falafel was decent but at about $6 I'm not sure I'd really feel the need to order it again but it seemed like a good idea at the time.  The wrap on the other hand was massive, filling and simply delicious. It was exactly what I needed after a long day of starvation.  I won't lie to you, I almost felt like ordering a second one. 

Seriously, this is exactly what is needed in this area. In a city of bustling night life and excellent bars, you're going to need a place with some solid, affordable and quality food options for some post-drinking indulgence.  SF Wraps meets that requirement quite well and surpasses it. If you're drinking at Rickhouse or something else nearby and you're hungry afterwards, you'd be foolish to pass this place up.  

If I ever end up visiting and doing the same crawl again, you'll know where to find me getting my grub on at the end of the night.
author: Jeff S.

description: Gave me a burrito instead of a gyro, what the heck is that about.  Couldn't finish it.  Better spots where I'm from.
author: Donnie R.

description: I ate a avocado wrap with baba garnish eggplant dressing vegan fresh superb quality i love it !
author: Lisa K.

description:
Walked in here near midnight expecting nothing great. Got the chicken plate. I was sharing with my GF and the owner suggested extra meat.

I gotta say. This place hit the spot! The food was good, and very fresh considering the time. I'm very happy with this meal, and with the friendly excellent service.
author: Alex L.

description: Great food for the price. The owner actually works here, and is very hospitable. A True gem.
author: Kyle F.

description: Walk in and the aroma is Amazing..Super Friendly Staff..Honestly The Best Looking wraps Ive seen in a while..plus the price is really to good to pass up.
author: Lorenzo J.

description: Got the baklava and order of chicken side as an app.  Was very happy with both items.  The chicken was exactly what I wanted some grilled chicken that was well marinated.  There was quite a bit of chicken for an appetizer!  I also enjoyed my baklava.  It had the right amount of filling, dough, and honey!  Hope to come by here again and try out a wrap!   The place was also open late on Friday night!!  The price of he food was very reasonable!
author: Abbas B.

description:
Yum yum yum yum yum yum! 

Came here twice in one week. Once drunkenly after happy hour and once after an afternoon meeting where I soberly confirmed that this place is super yummy! 

I got the same thing both times. I'm on a gluten free diet since the new year and pescetarian so my options are limited. I always get the falafel plate minus the bread. The hummus is by far my favorite! I usually love babaganoush (I will have to google and respell this later) but the one here is very bland. I wonder if they can give just two servings of the hummus instead. I usually am not a fan of falafel but theirs is not bad, especially smothered in the hummus. The side salad is bomb too! 

They serve everything in a plastic takeout box regardless if you're dining in or out. You have to ask them for water and there are desserts in the display case. They're surprisingly pricey though so I haven't gotten any. The guys here are super friendly and one of the few places open late.
author: Tiffany V.

description: Was starving, this place caught my eye so dropped by for a chicken plate to go. Opened it up when I got home, looked good but the chicken tasted like 2 year old expired oil, had a really fishy, stale taste that almost made me puke. Complete waste of money
author: Faizan A.

description:
We searched for an hour for dinner in the financial district. Almost everything was closed because of Chinese New Year or the fact that it was post-5pm.

SF Wraps saved the day, though they really should go for more of a Greek name. I really enjoyed my gyro platter and the baklava hit the spot! My spice-loving boyfriend commented that his Gyro Wrap was spicy - translation: he could've breathed flames - so, beware!

Thank you, come again? Too much to try nearby if we were ever back that way
author: Amanda W.

description: This place is in a great prime location and open late. Their falafel is ok. The wrap was overall good, worth the price.
author: Shreyas K.

description: One of my favorite place in the city!right place to get a right Mediterranean dishes in SanFrancisco!highly recommend to come and check this place out!they do provide excellent costumer service!enjoy guys
author: Arafat A.

description:
C'mon people. You know what this place is all about: it's about stuffing your pie hole with a delicious wrap thing. Get a delicious wrap thing for lunch and put it in your mouth hole. There are probably fancier or more intricate options around at that time. But it's zippy and it's simple.

Or, like the rest of us, rejoice that this place is open until around last call, and get in there in the middle of the late night and stuff your drunk mouth hole with delicious food. It's not JUST a place to get your drunk self something in the belly (or drunk friends or coworkers in the case of us non-drinkers), but it's ESPECIALLY good for that.

Combo wrap for me--a little gyro meat and a little chicken. It could have used a tad more sauce, but I hardly noticed as it was stuffed in my mouth hole and down my gullet. Good grief, it was just what I wanted. And the priced wasn't terrible. And the quantity was more than one could want. Slap it sloppily into your mouth, chomp down, and repeat.
author: Jeffrey S.

description:
Chicken shawarma wrap is amazing! It's the only thing I get because it's so good I can't bring myself to order anything else.

Add feta for extra deliciousness.

And you can get it as spicy as you want!

Yum!
author: Lauren G.

description: I always passed by this place but never gave it a try until today. I ordered a falafel plate and an avocado wrap, both of them were so delicious. I haven't had that good a falafel in any other place in the city. I love their pita. So light and soft. They also have varied cookie and sweets collection. Will definitely come back.
author: Sailaja B.

description: I went here because it was one of the few places open really late night on Sunday. I ordered the baba ganoush and the chicken plate. The quantity was really good. The food was quite tasty, especially the baba ganoush and the tzatski. However, I wish I had gotten an itemized list on my receipt.
author: Akansha G.

description: The salads satisfy my every craving & the atmosphere is awesome. So glad this place exists!
author: Meghan H.

description: Great people and great service! Feels like a true local business that you want to support. I got the chicken shawarma wrap and it's about 12 inches long. I highly recommend SF Wraps!
author: Kevin D.

description:
Do not get the gyro! 

I made this mistake twice and had to make sure I wrote a review to remind myself and others. That's the only thing I have gotten here but it was terrible enough that I would never go to this place again. 

What's wrong with it? The biggest problem is the meat. It's not gyro meat. It tastes horrible. I couldn't finish my wrap both times.

All the things that go with it are the bad version too. It's a gyro with lettuce and in a lavash. I hate Gyros with lettuce (not greek) and lavash gyros are always worse than pita gyros. And this is packaged, not fresh lavash like you get in the Middle East.
author: Aakash G.

description: Grab a wrap here after leaving the Bar nearby. The staff was really friendly and quick and the food was good for what it was. Will be coming back fro sure!
author: Austin R.

description:
I love everything at SF Wraps - authentic food, good portion, really really low price for the quality of the food. I work late / on the weekends a lot in a nearby building. SF Wraps is ALWAYS open. I can't think of more hardworking owners. 

Also highly recommend their "California Golden Cookies"! They don't make a lot each day. Spend a minute and read the story behind the cookies on the wall, please. The owner is so passionate about making cookies that it's inspiring.
author: Charis Nan J.

description:
The owner, Reza, was very kind and helped me fill a late night hunger run! 

Gyro was very authentic, clean facilities, and definitely great tasting food.

The gyro combo wrap is also a great deal. Definitely a great go to for a late night gyro fix!
author: Alpha E.

description: Awesome wrap!!! Came in with my hubby for a late dinner date and it hit the spot. Spicy is so good!!! And wraps are amazing! I seen some reviews saying that the bread breaks but it's bound to happen with pita bread so I took my time tearing the foil slowly as I ate down and it worked perfectly
author: Elisabet J.

description:
It is a very very great middle eastern food. 
You are drunk, you gotta go here. 
You are high, you gotta go here.
you are hungry, you gotta go here. 

the owner is really nice and the food is a lot and cheap :-)
they are open till 2 am and yiu can just show up, eat n go ;-)
author: Iman B.

description:
"Oh no!" This cheetah cries as he arrives to his restaurant of choice nearby. "Closed!" 

I found myself unsure of where to go for a quick lunch item as the place I had originally wanted to go to nearby was closed for some reason. 

Wandering back and forth the streets, I happened across SF wraps and decided to give it a go! 

I am a sucker for falafel so I decided to try to get the falafel wrap! Unfortunately, they were sold out! A place that advertises falafel proudly, sold out at lunch time??? How? :(

Oh well, decided to get the avacado wrap instead. 
The wrap was done quickly and served nice and warm in foil. The wrap itself was very flavorful and light, but it seemed like the fillings of veggies and sauce was lacking in flavor. Would have liked maybe some sort of more flavorful spread or maybe dressing. Even salt and pepper would have done a world of good for it. 

Overall, the wrap was nice and light, and had this cat decently satisfied. I may come back and try one of the other wraps, hopefully next time they have falafel! 

*chirp!*
author: Jei C.

description:
Late night Greek eats near Chinatown. Open til 2am daily, their menu features all the basic Greek foods plus some others. Walked in around 11pm on a Thursday and was delighted that the whole menu was still available. 

Food Review:
-Hummus $5: served chilled with a side of thin pita bread slices, tasted great
-Lentil Soup $5: oh so delish! Smooth blended with carrots, garlic and onion. Definitely a house made soup
-Falafel Plate $9: 4 pieces of falafel, comes with a side of hummus, pot bread and small salad. A bit chewy, I assume they microwaved to heat
-Gyro $8: lamb, cucumber, red onion, lettuce and tzatziki sauce. They do not skimp of the ingredients, so yum!

The owner is so nice! He makes the little shop feel very welcoming. TV was playing SNL so that added a splash of pizazz to our eat-in experience.
author: Celina Q.

description: This place is awesome! The wraps are so good and the owner is so kind. We heard such great things we stopped by and after serving us our wraps you could see him waiting to insure we were pleased. So kind! He also gave my husband a cookie because he was looking at them. Such a cool spot! Great food!
author: Danielle K.

description:
Formerly known as California Golden Cookies

What a fantastic little Mediterranean spot located right across the street from Rickhouse when you need something that helps to ease the pain that is to come the next morning. 

I decided to order the Shawerma wrap for dinner that night. The portion was great, filling was well composed and the meat was superb. It was tender, flavorful and a great amount of it as well. They give you the option of how you want spice, I opted for spicy. I loved the slow burn of the heat and how well it complimented everything in the dish.

Overall Thoughts

Definitely a go to spot for me whenever I am in the area and need a quick bite
author: Eddie W.

description:
Amazing place to eat very clean great service 
This has to be one the best hidden gems in the city 
Amazing food great price
author: Copastetic H.

description: Not the place to get falafel. I got falafel platter. Falafel tastes of baking soda and they warm up the falafel that are prefried. It was disgusting. The hummus has no taste and baba is worse. I threw the food instead of eating it.
author: Nichomachus P.

description: Easily the worst meal I've ever had-flavorless meat with random spices, thickly chopped veggies, and messy sauce. For $12 bucks. Spare yourself some heartache and grab something from Chipotle, Starbucks or Super Duper-all down the block.
author: Live F.

description: Cookies are life here. The CC cookies are freakin angelic. Ive never had better cookies and I'll put money down that this is the best cookie you'll ever have. Owner is super nice plus hooked me up when I ordered a bunch of cookies for work. All in all get the cookies.
author: Navdeep D.

description:
Get a wrap and only a wrap. Everything else on this menu is disgusting. We ordered the chicken breast meal. And, oh my lawd...the chicken was drier then the Sahara desert! Seriously, no taste and it looked like she grabbed it out the microwave. 

This is located in the heart of the financial district so I know damn well rent must be an arm and a leg! Geez, if I'm gna pay $13-15 for chicken at least give the people something satisfying. 

Two thumbs down -this place sucks!
author: Brian B.

description:
Grabbed the shawarma wrap for lunch on a weekday, super delicious! The meat was flavorful and it's a good amount of food for ~$10

The owner was incredibly nice and their service was quick.

Do not eat this prior to a meeting at work, it gets messy. The flatbread ripped after the 2nd bite even though I was using the tinfoil to keep it together (burrito style).
author: Cole S.

description:
The Wife and I had been wondering around during our honeymoon and happen to stumble into this very tiny shop pretty late in the night(late for us anyways) and decided to give them a try.

The wife had the chicken wrap and added something to it I believe, she wasn't a big fan of it nor the price overall, but she didn't hate it either.

However I had the Gyro and added some stuff to it as well and LOVED it. This has become a person favorite place for me which I may drag the wife to while we are in SF. 

The meat is amazing and the food just tasted very fresh. It was like feeling new flavors and textures for the first time and loving it. We have sense been back to the place and the owner is always very nice and quick at making the food.

We have seen a few issues with customers getting the wrong items, then during the same visit we ended up with a wrong item as well. But overall the food still was very good and worth it.

I do have to say the tiny room is  a bit too cramped for us, so we walk back to our hotel to enjoy the food. Its also a little warm in there for me. Add in the prices seem to be a bit steep, considering we also add somethings to our wraps too. But again the food is what matters and its delicious(to me) With the negatives I personally still give them a 4 out of 5, just wish the place was bigger and not as warm, I would also love a little cheaper prices but I can live with that.
author: John C.

description:
Wow wow I'm in nostalgic bliss before even eating my beautifully and truly made from the soul Jerusalem wrap. Wanted a snack before going home to the east bay. I am a rare find in the Bay Area now, born and raised in the Bay Area, my mom would take home these amazing cookies from fashion island where I also used to go to Malibu on the weekends. Well growing up they closed down years later and my whole family was sad because these cookies were heaven. While I'm waiting for my food, I read the article on the wall.. And it was Reza, the owner of SF WRAPS, who opened golden gate cookies!! 

I can't express how elated I am I stumbled upon this business. Not only do I get treated with excellent customer service, amazing food that you can taste and feel is made with love, the cookies I grew up eating!! I will for sure bring my family here when they return back to be Bay Area but I will gladly indulge on everything here for all the reasons you can think of that friendly people and good food and good memories stem from.

Offf I don't even know if this review makes any sense. Who cares because this establishment will not disappoint no matter who you are!
author: Anjo C.

description: Good Mediterranean hole in the wall with a variety of options. I had the combo platter for $12.00 - chicken was dry, but the gyro meat was tender and tasty, tsaziki sauce and hummus solid, and veggie wrap plentiful.
author: Will H.

description:
These people are rock stars! I came in here needing some help, they went above and beyond and their food was out do this world. If you're in the area make sure to check it out. What an amazing place.

Food is A1 !!
author: Mikey P.

description:
Owner is very kind and knowledgeable about food!!! 
A true foodie!

His cookies are amazing 
His middle eastern food good too.

Talk to him about healthy food.  Good wisdom here.
author: Dubl A.

description:
I love this new addition to the FiDi. It's a little shop that's easy to miss but has some amazing food to offer, for great prices! 

I got a Gyro for $7 and it was huge. Of course it was amazingly delicious and so I ate the entire thing. It's so hard to go anywhere else when you know that this is an option in the neighborhood. 

I have a coworker who's a vegetarian and this place is great for them. The Falafel wrap ($7) is also really great.
author: Mariko F.

description: First time here and split a meat lover's gyro with my friend. AMAZING. We will be back!!
author: Emmeline L.

description: One of the few places open at late night in SF. 3 star on the food, fourth star for staying open late in the night !! I had thought SF will have lot of late night places like NYC, but to my surprise it wasn't on my short trip. More to discover in SF.
author: Himanshu S.

description:
Great gyro. Great soup. Great service!!!(and I'm here at midnight) 

A great late night option.

Did I mention how great this place is?

My phones at 1%
And I just want to contribute to the praise for this place because it deserves it.
I'm trying to finish this before my phone dies.
author: Cooper C.

description:
Food (4/5): I got the avocado wrap, which was decent - it would have been amazing with salt and pepper though! It came with lettuce, tomatoes, cucumbers, red onions, and tahini. The tahini was a tiny bit watery. My bf got the gyro wrap, which I thought was much more flavorful. We really liked the gyro meat, and the food tasted really fresh. I wish the lavash was more toasted, though, but overall the food was pretty good.

Service (5/5): The owner is super nice, and even checked up on us and filled our water cups, something I totally didn't expect at such a casual place. 

Value (4/5): I think we paid about $10.60 each for a sizable wrap, and I was definitely full after the meal.
author: Abby S.

description: I came here for a quick lunch to bring to work, there were two issues: it took 20 minutes to get my food (all I ordered was a soup and salad) and they charged me $8.95 for something on a menu that was $7.45, that's a 20% premium, did they give themselves a tip while they were at it?
author: Angela S.

description: Love love love this place! My husband and I came upon this hidden Gem. We fell in love with food and the employees were so kind and awesome! A definite place to stop and eat at
author: Lena M.

description: Great bang for your buck - so few lunch spots around here are under $15 that actually fill you up, besides Chipotle. This place is great, and awesome service as well
author: Justin R.

description: Do not order the falafel. Food is oily, tastes as though it has been reheated in a microwave. Hummus is bland
author: Liz J.

description: I got a Chicken shawarma wrap last week while coming back from work in the evening. Service was quick and wrap tasted good. Would definitely stop by again in future for a quick grab and go
author: Sireesha G.

description:
My friends and I came here at around 1 or 2 am looking for a great place to eat. We were lucky to stumble upon this place! Located deep in the city near the nightlife areas, this is an ideal place to grab a quick bite as the night winds down. 

The owner was very friendly to us as we ordered. Since it was our first time, he gave us detailed descriptions of what was on the menu. He also didn't mind having a decent conversation with us which is nice to have at a late night restaurant. 

I ended up ordering the Shawarma wraps which were delicious! The meat was tender and there was tons of flavor. I especially liked the sauce as it was tasty and complemented the Shawarma pretty well. It's also wrapped up nicely in foil making it easy to take home in case you don't finish it.

I really like this place a lot since it's open late at night and they make delicious Shawarma wraps! The owners are friendly and are willing to talk to you. The place is kinda small but luckily it wasn't crowded when we went as we were able to relax and enjoy our food. I will keep this place in mind on my next late night adventure around the city!
author: Chris M.

description:
A friend and I decided to give SF Wraps a try for dinner.  We went to Greece years ago so we're always up for trying a new Mediterranean place.  

We ordered the gyros to go and asked if they could add avocado.  They both came to about $12 each.  We waited about 20 minutes.  The gyro was a really good portion and was filled with meat (lamb and beef), cucumber, tomatoes, red onion, lettuce and tzatziki sauce.  I ordered it mild and it was still more on the spicy side.  The meat didn't taste as fresh as I expected, but the amount of food you get for what you pay makes SF Wraps a great option if you're in the area and are looking for something to grab and go.
author: Christine D.

description: not sure if it was an off day but the falafel was probably the single worst falafel i've had in my entire life. not only was it soggy but it tasted like it had been made days ago w a refrigerator smell. plus the hummus that came w the plate was on the verge of tasting spoiled and the bread was like cardboard to say the least. i went in b/c it looked like an authentic, hole in the wall spot that takes pride in their food but i was sorely disappointed. i could only eat two of the falafels and only after drowning them in the avocado sauce and had to throw away the whole plate. just inedible. sorry.
author: N J.

description:
They have some good wraps. The falafel and shwarma taste very authentic. One sandwich is pretty filling. 

They actually have a decent baklava. The deserts were nothing amazing, but good if you're craving one and feeling gluttonous.
author: Victor A.

description:
I wanted to like this place more. I came in around 9PM, so not like a late night drunken "FEEDME!" moment.

The service was great. Very prompt and attentive.

But the food wasn't what it should have been. I got the gyro plate. 

The portion was large, no question. A lot of meat, a lot of hummus, and more tzatziki than one person could eat. But unfortunately, it was a situation where more ended up being less.

The meat: When you have a rotisserie gyro stand going, I sort of expect my gyro to come from that. Not pulled out of a rice cooker/crock pot in the back. And certainly not just chunks (not slices) of meat. To me, what makes a gyro (or shwarma, or döner kebab) REAL is that mix of crisp and tender... cutting the meat off as it is ready. What I got was salty beef cubes, warmed in a heater. No texture. And, I'm assuming homemade, because it lacked seasoning other than the salty flavor. 

The sides: the hummus had a nice flavor, but was watery. And the tzatziki tasted like what I could buy at a Cash & Carry. If it was homemade, it needs a major garlic and dill injection.

I really wanted to like this more. The owner seems honestly caring and responsive to feedback here, so I'm hoping this comes across as constructive feedback rather than bitching. 

All this place needs to be awesome is a bit less quantity and a bit more quality.
author: Jim C.

description: This place is good when you want to avoid the long lunch lines in fidi on a week day. The food is fine, not great but not terrible. What I like is that for the price (~$7-$8) compared to other lunch places in the area, you get a good amount of food. Taste wise I've had better gyros, but I've definitely had worse. The meat was tender but overall I thought the wrap could have had a little more flavor.
author: Chanel H.

description:
Prices are a little ridiculous - $9.50 for a gyro, but I suppose SF is a little ridiculous overall these days. I went around 6:30pm on a Sunday night and the place was entirely empty. The gyro was okay - well spiced meat and solid portion. 
I'd probably come back but it would have to be very late, and I would have to be a little more inebriated...
author: Joe L.

description:
Ordered to go and the tzatziki sauce was way passed spoiled. I spit it out.

My total was $12.80 yet the cashier gave me $0.12 change.

I wasn't given a receipt and as a stood waiting for my food about two minutes after my order the cashier welcomed me again and asked for my order. I told him I already paid and he nodded like he recalled taking my order.

The giant guy making my food wasn't wearing gloves and was constantly wiping his brow because he was sweating like mad.

I have them one star for being open when everything else was closed. They lost stars for short changing me, forgetting my order, the unsanitary conditions, and for serving me sauce that clearly was bad.
author: Eric E.

description: Food is on point!!!  Manager is also a really great guy and super friendly.  So good i came twice in one night!!
author: Paiman V.

description:
I don't really want to write a review of SF Wraps because I've noticed the owner comments on everyone's reviews. Ugh for comments. Lately I've been getting a lot of unsolicited comments full of spitfire and vitriol in my Yelp mailbox. My sister, Johnna S., said that nothing good ever comes in the Yelp inbox. She ain't never lied. My reviews are a play-by-play of my experience. That seems fair. You'll note, for the record, that the vast majority of my reviews are 4-5 stars. 

One Friday afternoon I was craving the food of my people (half of my people, anyway), and decided to give SF Wraps a try. I was pretty busy, however, and needed to make quick work of lunch. I hoofed it to SFW and noticed that there were only a few people in line. Sweet. 

It took a long time for me to place my order. I became confused, and I wondered if I was actually in the line. I asked the guy in front of me if he had ordered yet, because it seemed like an uncommonly long wait to place an order. He looked at me with annoyance and replied with a curt "no." Okay, I admit that was annoying. Whoops. 

When it was my turn, I ordered a gyro lavash. There were only two people working at SFW that day. One was taking the orders and delivering them, and one was cooking. 

SFW is teensy, just like every other restaurant in the area. I parked myself at a table to wait, since everyone appeared to be ordering take out. 

A man came in and ordered after me. He sat at the table next to mine. And I'm fairly certain he was wearing purple contacts. Purple. Contacts (c. 1993). 

Because I checked in on Yelp immediately upon my arrival, I was able to keep track of how long everything was taking. Of course, while I was waiting, my boss sent me 100 emails--I could just see his head spinning all the way around as he wondered if I had died during my lunch hour. I became antsy.

It took 20+ minutes to get a single wrap to go. Yikes--that's too long for takeout at lunch. SFW is a new business, so they may just need a little time to work out the kinks. Let's focus on the positive. 

+1 star for price. Another spot located in the FiDi where you can get a great lunch for under $10! My lavash was $7-$8--hurrah! 

+1 star for healthy fare and portion size. My gyro wrap was more gigantic than the Pixies' song. It was surprisingly light and healthy-full of leafy greens and evenly distributed gyro meat. I had one half for lunch and the other half for dinner. It was pretty tasty, to be sure. 

SFW is a solid spot, overall. The only problem is the wait. Just my opinion. Please don't send me a message stating that this review sucks and that as a result of this review you hate both me and my mama. Thanks.
author: Sunny S.

description:
Ordered the Lentil soup and Falafel plate. The salad and falafels were fresh. The soup was hot and fresh as well. 
Great staff and Christmas movies to boot. Perfect late night winter experience.
author: Guru S.

description:
We are visiting from Dallas and fortunately SF Wraps was open Thanksgiving Day for dinner. I had a gyro plate that came with gyro meat, small salad, hummus, tzatziki, and bread. Portion size was good but wish I had gotten some more bread. Good flavors and thankful they were open.

Btw, my wife had a gyro wrap which was enough for 2 people to share.

I also had the Turkish Delight which was only okay but expensive at $5.
author: Haroon S.

description: Just really bad food. Got a chicken plate and the chicken tasted like it just came from the freezer, then the microwave.
author: Alessandro B.

description:
I came here with a few work colleagues and we were all craving for some good kebab. Although we did find a pretty tasty wrap here, I would not say their shawarma tastes like the real deal. It was definitely good, but the meat was pretty different from what I expected (it was more similar to kofte than to actual shawarma I would say). 

Despite that, I enjoyed my meal, and the wrap was quite big (which seems fair considering the price, 10 USD). The staff was nice and efficient and I would totally return, but if you are in the mood for a proper turkish kebab, this is probably not the best option. The store is quite small but there are are a few tables available, and although it seems like there is no bathroom, there is one hidden in the back, all you have to do is ask.
author: Gabriele J.

description:
Pros
Huge sando. Size. Shawarma.

Cons
Mystery meat inside. I was hungry (lunch less today) and I still could not finish it. The bread and other elements fine, but the meat was just not good gyro level
author: Eric T.

description:
SF wraps was the only place open late on Friday night in the Financial District (we had a BART fail and lost an hour, and thus, apparently, the option to eat in the Financial District).

I had the chicken plate, which was served with a side of thin pita bread slices.  I usually like to wrap my chicken in the pita with some hummus, but that was a bit difficult. I prefer thicker, larger slices of pita.  The chicken itself was good, nothing spectacular about the flavor and it definitely needed the hummus and tzatziki that came on the side to add flavor to it.  On the plus side, it wasn't greasy at all and tasted pretty healthy.

An okay spot for Greek food, and being the only option at the time definitely served our needs, but there's definitely better Greek food out there.  I will say that the service was great and they were very nice!
author: Flora H.

description:
Just a note: California Golden Cookies and SF wraps are the same thing, for anyone confused about the double Yelp listing.

Came here around 11 pm on a Thursday night and ordered the Combo Wrap and the Jerusalem Wrap. Both were huge and fresh and jam-packed with protein.

The Combo Wrap - on lavash
Chicken, Gyro meat (lamb and beef), tomatoes, onions, FREAKING SPRING MIX LETTUCE, cucumbers, and tzatziki sauce
This one was definitely my favorite. The chicken was juicy and flavorful. Be sure to ask for it spicy!

The Jerusalem Wrap - also on lavash
Falafel, hummus, eggplant spread, feta, tahini, cucumber, tomatoes, onions, spring mix lettuce
This one was also delicious, but the falafel was quite different than what I'm used to- it had a somewhat displeasing herbal smell and didn't taste very much like chickpeas.

That said, you get a ton of food for your money, and the service is friendly and quick. Can't beat those late hours either!
author: Lane B.

description: One of the worst shawarma places in the city. The food was clearly stale. Specially the chicken, which felt as if it was just microwaved before serving.
author: Nitin S.

description:
I took a detour on my way so I could make a stop here and pick up a gyro. This is a tiny hole in the wall which is the type of place that usually serves up great food.

The owner was very nice and friendly. I got the gyro and had to splurge and get an halwa as well. Apparently they make the baklava there but the halwa comes from another place. He also shared that they had other stores around the Bay Area at one point and are looking at opening another location. I hope they do and I wish them much success.

The gyro was slightly disappointing.  There was also too much lettuce and other fluff and not enough meat in the gyro. He also gave me a complimentary baklava which was really nice of him and it was very good.
author: Sunil R.

description:
While staying in the bay for the week, I was hungry late at night and couldn't find many places open.

Fortunately, I found this place on Yelp and it's a GEM. I got the gyro wrap and it was absolutely delicious. It was big and filled with fresh, healthy ingredients. My lady got the rice plate and the portion was big and she loved it! Furthermore, their service was TOP NOTCH. We were treated really well and their staff was extremely friendly. I'll definitely be coming back! Highly recommend to anybody who's in SF & needs a late night bite (also great for lunch/dinner during the day!)
author: Arrad R.

description:
They have a really good selection of food from their salads to their wraps. Everything is high quality from the freshness of the food to the service they give. 

My personal go-to is usually the Chicken Wrap or the Greek Salad with chicken.

What tops it off for me is that this a healthy late night option as well. If you're like me, then you know how rare it is to see the words "healthy" and "late night" together when searching for food! Well look no further because this is the best healthy late night spot there is.
author: Hector O.

description: I'm very sad!  The owner messed up my order; switched it with the lady in front, who ordered a supremely bland chicken wrap.
author: Carolyn L.

description: Food was fast, delicious, and A LOT! Fresh ingredients made in a squeaky clean kitchen (I know because I took a peak on my way to use their restroom). The service was friendly and exceeded expectations. If I loved here, I'd be back again and again! Tried the gyro, hummus, and baklava. Loved the meat and flatbread the most.
author: Deb R.

description:
Good food for a quick bite. Coming from the middle East, the "sharwama" didn't really do justice to the name. But to it's credit, it tasted good in it's way.
Would recommend if you just want to grab a quick bite with friends.
author: Sailesh M.

description: I'm loving it , it the best place to find the good food after midnight . Costumer service its outstanding and friendly . Great place to eat and hang out after party . Try once you will that in right ...
author: Amir H A.

description: Soooo came here after those long walking miles of around the city and wanted something quick, easy, yet healthy.  Came to sf wraps to see what they were about. I ordered the chicken breast plate which cost me roughly $12-13 after taxes. Now, let me just say this place is GARBAGE. The chicken breast was drier than the mojave desert and NO FLAVOR. For the salad I was expecting the usual cucumber/onion/tomato salad like they usually sell at most mediterranean places. Instead I just got lettuce tomatoes and dressing let's not talk about the hummus that tasted like it was from Safeway's grocery deli section smh. Now I'm only giving them 2 stars for making it somewhat healthy and the cook who was probably the owner was nice. Portions are small. If you want to be fulfilled with a good Mediterranean meal that is quick and ez, head over to zaytoons off Valencia. You get your money's worth.... trust me.
author: J N.

description:
First time visiting San Francisco, so I hit up China town for food at night (bad idea) - lots of places closed, EXCEPT for SF Wraps, so I check it out because I like Gyros. I forget the name of the owner (I think it was the owner that I spoke with...edit: Reza!!!) and he was incredibly friendly. I got one of their Gyros, which is HUGE and deliciously stuffed with meat and vegetables. The meat was great, everything about it was wonderful, I went back to my hotel satisfied after eating it inside the shop - a tiny little place that, I'm told, has been open for over 30 years, which is amazing.

Note: SF Wraps does not accept bills over $20. I only had a $50 in addition to $12 in cash. The owner shaved a dollar and change off my total price, which was BADASS!!! I was made to feel welcome to San Francisco because of SF Wraps, and you can bet that I will be going back next time I am in town :D
author: Mike B.

description: Amazing gyro. came here two nights in a row. ordered a gyro wrap the first night and a combo wrap the second night along with a side of just the gyro. the gyro is cubed instead of shaved, allowing you to get all the flavor from the meat. not from the area, but it is definitely going to be a tradition to get it everytime I come here.
author: Kellen M.

description: Wonderful place with excellent customer service. They went out of their way to accommodate my order and I really appreciate it.
author: AceOf S.

description:
I was pleasantly surprised to find this place still open at some god-awful hour in the early morning after a night of bar hopping in the area.

The place is staffed by one man, and as customers tend to come in groups together, service is slow, but it's to be expected.

The food is pretty good, flavorful, and awesome portions. I tried the shawarma, which was delicious, and more than enough to share between two people.

If in the area and craving late-night eats that go beyond fast food, definitely check this place out!
author: Claire S.

description:
You know how when you take an exam, you get 1 point for simply writing your name on the paper? That's how I feel about SF Wraps. The establishment exists, so it gets one attendance point. 

The gyro plate was abysmal - the meat tasted like fried spam (no texture, extremely mushy, zero flavor, oily). The hummus was very thin and watery. The lavash was really thin and tasteless, and the vegetables/yogurt were foul and slightly sweet. The chicken plate wasn't much better. While it didn't taste like spam, the babaghanoush was awful. I was also surprised that neither of the plates came with rice - that's a first for any Mediterranean joint I've been. After a few bites of each, we had to throw out both dishes.

I hate giving this a terrible review, because service was really friendly and accommodating. But given the average standard of Bay Area restaurants, this was incredibly disappointing and a loss of $25.
author: Crystal J.

description: I had the vegetarian wrap and it was really good! Great place to get a quick bite in union square and employees are very friendly.
author: Ashley S.

description: walking around there are so many options to stop by and eat. The other reviews left before me are very positive and it seems like the owner is very active on yelp, This made me want to try this spot out. Glad I did! The size of the falafal (gyro wrap) is gigantic and this is coming from 6'2 280 pound man. The flavor of the spicy sauce was great. If I wasn't in San Francisco surrounded by food spots I'd get two! thanks for the service. A+
author: Christian C.

description: Amazing service, amazing gyros!  The owner is the sweetest guy ever!  You will leave smiling and satisfied.  I always get the gyro plate with avocado and feta cheese.  Fresh food, great presentation, open late, and the best customer service!  Love love love!
author: Eunice K.

description: Best food I had while visiting San Francisco. The owner was super friendly and personal. I had the 'Meat Lovers' wrap with gyro meat and added feta; extra spicy. The lavash type bread wrap is a nice touch so you're not eating a super thick pita or anything, the meat was perfectly seasoned and nice and chunky. I also had the baklava which was great. I'll be back!
author: Colin R.

description: Good but not great.  Wonderful they are open late and the people working were just the nicest people.  The hummus was really good and the gyro meat probably among the best I've had.  The chicken however was overcooked and dry.  The rice was nice and fluffy and they had a good basic selection of Mediterranean food.  I would definitely go there again for a late night snack. A 3.5 star place if I could give it that.
author: Craig Y.

description:
I almost missed this place as I was looking for the old store name, which used to be California Cookie or something like that.  

I was looking for this place as their Middle Eastern dessert cookie selections were insanely good.  I have no idea what they are called but involve a lot of pistachios and honey wrapped in a thin crispy cookie shell.  Baclava maybe?

My first visit here the owner guaranteed that he will give me my money back if I didn't like the cookie.  Of course I took him up on his dare and sure enough he was not f'ing around.  So when I was in the neighborhood again I went looking for the shop and would have walked right past if it wasn't for the cookie display case.

Hopefully the name/facade change does not result in any loss of business as the place was pretty nondescript in the first place.
author: Stephen J.

description: I went here with my co worker. The gyro wrap was pretty good. Fresh vegetables. It's different. We liked it. Good portions. They don't skimp on the meat. I got some chocolate chip cookies. Things were ridiculous. So good. The owner came over and spoke with us for a bit. Seems like a nice guy. Overall it was a good experience. I would definitely recommend.
author: Jeremy T.

description: We had two chicken shewarma, which were dry, two pieces of chicken, the rest was full of onions and, tomatoes with no flavor what's so ever. It should be called onion wrap. Plus it's $10. don't waste ur $10, go somewhere elses.
author: Sol B.

description: My gf and I were in the city for drinks and a concert at the Masonic when we yelped this place for a quick bite. We split a lamb gyro which we liked to call a "gyritto" because it's a lot like a Mediterranean burrito. Meat, veggies, sauce were good and it was tasty. Service was good and timely. It wasn't mind-blowing however or a must try kind of place, hence the 4 stars. We aren't deterred from being returning customers, but there are lots of restaurants down the strip of where this place is located to try as well
author: Quoc N.

description: Grabbed dinner here last night to take back to my hotel. Had a combination of two wraps and it included chicken, feta, red onions cucumbers and  tzatziki sauce. Impossible to go wrong with these ingredients, right? Right. The service was fast and friendly, the bread was good and not overly filling, the portion was hefty and the ingredients were tasty and fresh. All and all, I am pleased with my experience and will be back next time I am hungry and in the neghborhood
author: Linda M.

description: Jerusalem Falafel Wrap was delicious! Be sure to get it spicy. Owner was lovely and attentive to the patrons and the price was spot on. I wish they were in my neighborhood!
author: Courtney J.

description:
Went here with the girlfriend while we were in SF. Call me crazy, but this wasn't anything special at all. I got the shawarma, and there wasn't a ton of meat, the flavors were so-so, and it was SUPER messy. 

There were some plusses:
-The food was quick, as we were the only ones in there, which was nice. Service was friendly as well.
-The portion sizes were ENORMOUS. Which would be good if the food was good, but since I didn't enjoy mine, I ended up giving about a third to a homeless guy in the area, and I wasn't even full.
-Spicy is actually spicy, which is nice.

Girlfriend didn't really care for her veggie wrap either, nor did I. Despite the friendly and quick service, since there were 2 dishes that weren't really up to par, I'll probably go elsewhere in the future.
author: Akshay A.

description:
OMG. THIS PLACE.

I am nutty about reading reviews before going anywhere, but in a fit of exhaustion after a long day stumbled into SF Wraps tonight and took a gamble with the gyro platter.

Everything about it was perfect. The hummus was some of the best I have ever tasted and the gyro meat was spectacular: perfectly seasoned and fresh. There was easily enough food for two meals. The service was quick, and the man who took my order was super friendly.

I am so glad I tried this place. I will definitely be back!
author: Emily O.

description: For late night financial district munchies, this is pretty much your only stop. It's more of a three star joint, but the hours give it that four star bump. My mixed gyro had kinda grainy chicken and gyro meat, which is kinda weird but there weren't better options and they whipped it up fast enough for me to make it to BART.
author: Misha T.

description:
***ASK ALI (or Reza) for the wraps a little "PERSIAN STYLE" as I call it! (not on the menu but that's how they made it for me and I called it that--by that I mean DO NOT skip the onions and pickles! And whatever else he puts in there! It was like a gooey crispy saucy meaty party in my mouth!

The staff at this little hole in the wall are friendly (and seem to care for the local folks in the area, which makes me happier to support their business!)They have a lot of experience: the owner had a cookie and brownie shop for many years. Great place for a quick bite ....sweets, salad, soup, and no frills but satisfying Mediterranean wraps. They serve late night and have very large portions.
author: s t.

description:
SF Wraps is my go to gyro spot downtown. It's delicious, and they are more than generous on their meat to veggie ratio. 

But here's the pro tip: get the cookies. These are the best cookies I've had in SF, hands down. They must be filled with cat nip or something because they're super addicting.
author: John B.

description: Shawerma wrap was $9.19 after tax. This is my first visit here. I wanted to try someplace new. The wrap was bigger than I thought. I said yes to getting it spicy. I usually cannot tolerate too much spiciness, but this tasted fine to me (not too hot). I ate 1/3 of the wrap and I was already full. The wrap itself was good but not great. My favorite is Truly Mediterranean on 16th St, but it's not conveniently located for me. The wait for the shawerma wrap was not long. I went shortly after they opened.
author: Wendy L.

description:
After reading how many other people stumbled in to SF Wraps after being hungry and tired late at night, you would think competing businesses in the area would stay open and take advantage of the market.
