They're sleeping (heh) and SF Wraps is reaping the benefits. I'm glad SF Wraps exists. But for them, *someone* would have had a very bad night.

Like others have mentioned, I discovered SF Wraps whilst wandering the neighborhood late at night. I'd just gotten off a cross-country flight and i was hAngry. Shocked that so few restaurant options were open to me, I pulled out my Yelp app with the last remaining strength I had (I'd been walking the streets like a street walker for an hour and prior to arriving at my destination, had made the mistake of using a shuttle service; I was done) and up popped SF Wraps. Done. 

I walked in and was forced to listen to drunk girl™ prattle on and on about nothing anyone cared about. Just as I was about to lay hands on her, her more sober friend sensed her imminent danger and pulled her out of the resto. 'Soup. I need lentil soup... a combo wrap... some sort of juice... and that chocolate thing. Please... so weak...' Seeing my feeble and broken form, the gentleman behind the bar got to my order with terrific speed. In no time, I had my food and was off to the hotel. The soup was made with yellow lentils and was nicely seasoned. I was afraid that the consistency was going to be too runny and while on the thinner side, I found the soup to have a nice depth to go along with its flavor. It was so good, in fact, I drizzled the lentils over my combo wrap. Speaking of that wrap, get it. A combo of meats. A chorus of veggies. A cubic liter of sauceS. I devoured that thing and it wasn't because I was so hungry. It really was that good. About to slip in to a food coma, I spied the 'chocolate' thing. I have no idea of the name but it was chocolate, almonds, a bit flaky, and I ate it like a candy bar. So.good. Thanks to SF Wraps, I drifted in to pleasant sleep and wasn't forced to extend bodily harm to any bystanders. SF Wraps saves lives!
author: Johnny T.

description: How have I never been here? This is the cleanest restaurant in this area, open late, super nice people work here AND the food is delicious! The falafel is moist and the wraps are awesome. YUM
author: Marisa L.

description:
Fresh and tasty wraps.Being vegetarian its always challenging to find tasty meal. We tried Falafel wrap and avacado wrap. Both were really good.  
Falafel was remarkably better than many other Mediterranean places I have tried before. I am sure they have their secret recipe. 
This is a family owned restaurant, small sized and reasonably priced menu, good customer service plus it was open late night. I would certainly stop by if happened to be around.
author: Rasesh P.

description: We were searching for a place to grab a quick lunch in downtown area and we came across this place. It looked OK but still we wanted to give it a try because of the good reviews. I'm so glad we did ! We had ordered Falafel wrap and it was big enough to fill our tummy. It was saucy and spicy just like we wanted :) It was just delicious ! The lady at the counter was extremely warm The Excellent taste and the wonderful customer service will force you to visit this place again :) I would definitely recommend this place :)
author: Psd S.

description: Food was good for late night grub. But the cashier overcharged me. I thought it was possible it was an honest mistake until I watched him do they same thing to multiple patrons as I waited for my wrap. I am not sure if he was taking advantage of the late night crowd - but with only a few beers in me... I thought it was my duty to report this so others' wallets don't suffer.
author: PJ F.

description: Mmmm this is legit. Authentic Mediterranean food made by the guy who took my order. I had the chicken plate, and the chicken was so flavorful and delicious. The hummus was great, as was the tzatziki. It was very creamy and thick. It was served with lavosh instead of pita, which was a little too thin for me. I like the thick pita more. But overall, a really wonderful meal.
author: Ashley P.

description: Exactly what I wanted and thank you for being open on Sunday! Big wrap with good tasting meat and sauce and enough fresh veggies to make me feel I'm eating kinda healthy. Clean space and excellent service from the young lady
author: Selene N.

description: Very helpful.  I stopped last night at 2am, and he asked me to stay in my car after completing my order so that it wouldn't get towed. He brought the order out to me.
author: Peter C.

description: Met a friend here for a quick dinner. The place was clean and simple, with a fair variety of menu choices. I ordered the spicy falafel wrap. I'm not sure what their definition of "spicy" is, but the wrap was fairly mild. Flavors were alright, though, so I can't complain too much. Coupled with a fairly dry flathead wrap, the experience was nothing memorable.
author: Tyler A.

description: I could probably eat here everyday!! When I visited New York, everyone told me i HAD to try the falafels. I did. It didn't live up to the hype so from that experience, falafel wraps were never my first choice when deciding on what to eat. Luckily my bf brought me here and I got the falafel wrap. It was amazing! I devoured it.  It was big..maybe 12inches and could have probably served two ^@^ It was flavorful, stuffed with crunchy, cubed cucumbers, tomatoes, baby greens, falafels, yogurt and hot sauce. Mmmm! The man who usually here is very friendly! I've been back four times since! You can't beat the price either! (The falafels would be tastier if they were fresh and crispy, but guess you can't have it all)
author: Chanel H.

description: The shawarma wrap was great. The service was friendly. I highly recommend them if you're in the neighborhood.
author: Mark S.

description: Great food - the gyros, baba ghanoush and rice were awesome. Great prices too. Would definitely recommend for a quick bite
author: Priyanka G.

description: Ducked in here after failing to find the sushi place I was looking for. Had a spicy gyro wrap, easily the best I've ever had - and I enjoy lamb.
author: Kay T.

description: Went here for the first time for a quick bite to eat. The reviews here are correct. SF Wraps is wonderful! The portions are generous and one wrap can easily be shared by two people. The place is clean and inviting.  My only complaint is that the shwarma wrap is really the same thing as the gyro wrap, with the addition of hummus. If you're looking for traditional beef shwarma, this isn't it.
author: Fannie B.

description: I only had the hummus, and it was amazing. Besides that, their hospitality was beyond my expectations. Thank you so much for you services and tasty food. Coming back for a gyro next visit.
author: Martin G.

description: Amazing service! Great food! Love it  the man served us water when we were eating. I had the gyro wrap and it was so big and amazing. Go here if your thinking about it!!!
author: Paul V.

description:
I got the gyro wrap an it was really big and only $6.50! Really tasty. He asked if I wanted it spicy and I said "how spicy?" and he offered to give it to me medium which was perfect.

The meat is really good quality. Would definitely come here again, I'd like to try the Avocado Wrap.
author: Alexandra W.

description:
Pros: 
- Open Late
- Yummy gyro and chicken
- Nice employees

Cons:
- Wraps were almost $10 with no sides or drinks
- Huge chunks of cucumber, tomato, and meat so that when you take a bite you only get a mouthful of one ingredient instead of all together.
- More veggies than meat.
- Tzaziki sauce needed more of an oomph.  More lemon or more garlic or both!
author: Walerz B.

description: The staff is nice and the food is really good. I got the falafel plate and my boyfriend got a gyro and we both enjoyed our meal. I definitely recommend this place!
author: Crystal G.

description: Good food, quick and filling, really nice owner (Reza).
author: Kevin A.

description: Huge portion! This place opens very late too.  The staff is also very friendly.  Everything seems fresh and tasty.
author: Rissa K.

description:
I had the chicken shwarma and cinnamon sugar cookie. I left incredibly full. The owner was very kind. 

I prefer the chicken at Sunrise Deli just a little bit more, but this place is closer (and still delicious). I'd come back again.
author: Eduardo R.

description:
There are few good late night options in the financial district but this one is just amazing for the price.

The portions are super big, fresh tasting, tasty. I always get the Jerusalem (I think that's the name). It's super loaded with hummus, eggplant, and feta. I try not to eat cheese and forgot to order without last time, but it was so tasty I couldn't stop and scarfed the whole thing. The baklava was really tasty and fresh considering I ordered it so late. So flakey and perfectly crunchy. Yum!

The guy that is always there when I come in, whom I suspect is the owner is very pleasant and comes across friendly. The place has a good air about it. It's lacking enough ambiance to make me want to dine in, but is perfect for takeaway.

I'm giving the place five stars because of the service, price, freshness, and taste... although realistically 4.5 stars. Only thing lacking is decor but for my purposes it's just fine.

Keep up the good work guys! You are appreciated :)
author: Cassandra M.

description: Umm... Came here on a whim. Regretted it after the first bite. The chicken was terrible -- tasted chalky like it was just thawed. It was definitely not fresh. I didn't even taste grilled! More like dusty white meat that's so old it's barely even holding together. The garlic sauce was almost flavorless, and the Pita bread tasted like malnourished warm cardboard. STAY AWAY!
author: Joe T.

description: Great service, the owner? was super friendly and accommodating, even cut the gyro in half for me and offered a paper bag and extra foil for leftovers. Gyro was much larger than I expected, great value for price !
author: Joy H.

description: The man behind the counter (owner?) is so friendly and serves with a smile.  I had the Shwarma Wrap made spicy.  Delicious.  Great friendly and fast service. Hard to find in this area nowadays:)
author: Al O.

description: Coming here was an amazing Falafel experience, not jus because food was amazing Greek nicely done and fresh, but because we felt very welcome. Owner showed very much care for our dog, and even gave us warm cookies for the walk, so much extra caring and service, haven't felt like this in years on a food store. Not jus we will get back forever, but we will always recommend this place. A wonderful experience.
author: Zorka A.

description: I got a spicy chicken gyro and what I got was extremely dry and lacked flavor. That and the wrap itself was so dry it cracked and fell apart just from holding it. I think more ended up in the street than in my mouth.
author: Brandon M.

description:
Given the fact that I came here after going to Local Edition, SF Wraps was a nice little find. We were trying to get some Mexican food, but gyros wasn't a bad shout. It's pretty small, nothing fancy, but the food comes out really quickly. I ordered the gyro wrap, and it was pretty good. I remember it being pretty juicy, so I got some stains in my dress.. but in my drunken state, I just kept chowing down.

Nice little spot but didn't think it was anything out of the ordinary.
author: Erin H.

description: This was the perfect place for a late meal. My wife and I had arrived at our hotel after 9:00 and wanted something quick and not too heavy. We each had the falafel wraps. Delicious and fresh tasting. The owner took our order and was very nice. He even gave us a choco-chip walnut cookie to go.
author: J. B.

description: I wasn't the biggest fan of this place.  The wrap was ok but what really affected the rating was the falafel with Tahini.  Unfortunately those were probably the worst falafels I have ever had.  I had to return them.
author: Kirsten M.

description: Great place for a bite to eat . Stopped in while visiting family members who are regulars at the shop. The wrap was very good and the meat (lamb) was cooked to perfection.  Only problem was there was a limited amount of seating (making it almost only good for take out ) and the owner reminded me of the soup nazie from Seinfeld (if you get the reference). Definitely worth another stop in.
author: Jeff W.

description: Not much to say other than the felafel I had was below average. Not flavorful or crispy. Also,the flour wrap should have been toasted. Quite frankly, it tasted like cardboard. I won't go back.
author: S. G.

description: I don't normally write reviews, but the owner opened the doors to us after they're closed. He made us amazing wraps after hours on a weekday night and accommodated us all!! Highly recommend!!!
author: Maggie C.

description:
Great falafel! It was freshly made (and huge), even at 10pm at night. The service was nice and cordial and the place was clean. Can't ask for more when you're hungry late at night. 

I would consider picking a better name though.
author: A J.

description: This place is clutch. I have been coming here for years and the owner is cool and the food is top notch.  Falafel wrap is solid and the best part is that they are open late. Awesome
author: Petey F.

description:
I had their spicy gyro, and it was soooo good. I definitely recommend it. 

I came here to write this - they have these "turkish delights" that are chewy and sweet and completely amazing!"

The best part of the place was the owner who was incredibly nice and made me feel very welcomed!
author: Anahid S.

description: 3 stars means A-OK: I would go here again. This place is open on the weekends in the otherwise shuttered Financial District. I had the falafel wrap and enjoyed it; my one complaint is that the falafel wrap has a bit too much wrap compared to the delicious goodness inside.
author: Miguel C.

description: You vl love this place. Have been here 4 times in 2 weeks of stay in SF, never left dissappointment.. love its falafel plate, chicken wrap and soup..
author: Shobhit N.

description:
I happened to come across this place just two days into my start of working in the city. My first day in the city I had a disappointing pulled bbq pork sandwich (from a shop which I shall not name), however my 2nd day here I happened to find this place on yelp and after hearing all my friends rave about how good shawarma and gyro is, I decided to give this place a try.

After today all I can say is that I'm definitely coming back in the future. The guy that took my order (I think he might be the owner) greeted me with a big smile and made me feel extremely welcome. Even if the food wasn't good id still want to give this man my money just for his superb customer service. I got the spicy gyro wrap for 6.95 and that thing was huge. Packed with gyro, sauce and fresh veggies, this was for sure the right place to have my first gyro. I think everyone who works in or visits sf should definitely give this place a try.
author: Jeffrey C.

description: I ordered a falafel wrap and had to order the baklava... both were amazing! The restaurant was clean, well kept, and the owner was super friendly.
author: M M.

description: Baklava soooooo good, I walked a mile from my hotel at night to get some, only to learn they were out! Now they're on my sh*t list until I get some.
author: Matthew W.

description: Best chicken shawarma in the city + best cookie I've ever had! The owner, reza, is a complete joy! Thanks for the birthday cookie...will be back on my lunch breaks!
author: Lauren C.

description: It's a decent place to grab quick food while working late in the evening when you're living that  Financial District life. Comes out to be around 8-9 dollars a wrap.
author: Andrew S.

description: Decent price for the amount of food you get. Got a gyro, wasn't that great. Taziki wasn't too strong and the bread wasn't that tasteful but the portion size is large and worked for an inexpensive lunch. The gentleman behind the counter was extremely nice and they were busy but our food came out quickly.
author: Jay O.

description: Walking SF Union district area we were looking for something local and different and falafel plate was a perfect choice. It came with sides of Babaganush and Hummus  and both tasted awesome! The Resturant was very clean and the food was well prepared and delicious. Staff were very polite and friendly and we enjoyed our food and had a good time. Will return for sure!
author: Cyrus H.

description: I eat here about once a week for lunch.  The Jerusalem Wrap is the best vegetarian option I've found in FiDi, and the chicken wrap is also delicious.  The falafel are crispy on the outside and fluffy in the middle.  They really seem to care about the quality of the food.
author: Andrew M.

description: I live in Sacramento but frequently visit family in the city. Was out late with a case of munchies and randomly drove by this place and said what the heck let's try it. Jackpot! Love the food and the owners are very cool. Well worth it.
author: Erik O.

description: Oh god, The food was tasty, but it made me and my friend really sick. I had late night gyros and woke up with a stomachache. I thought this was normal, because I might be hungover. Then I ate leftovers later that day, and almost immediately felt sick again. I see that no one has ever complained about this, so maybe something was just a little off this night.
author: Tommy D.

description: Great service and good value for the food. Tried the Jerusalem wrap, spicy, and it was good. The food was fresh and delivered fast. The cashier (maybe he's the owner?) saw me get so excited to share a baklava with my boyfriend that he have me another one for free. It's nice when the owner is responsive to his clients. Will  definitely be back!
author: Miriam L.

description:
I ordered the falafel wrap. The wrap itself was average, nothing wrong with it and the ingredients.

But the falafel balls in the wrap were disgusting. And I am a falafel lover. But this was no good. I had to throw half my wrap away. 

The customer service is good though.
author: Saumya B.

description: I always take a falafel wrap to go. It is good and fills you up. I'm not asking for anything more. It does the job!
author: Antonin A.

description:
While I generally try to eat a lighter, healthier lunch, when I splurge I often end up here. The food is fresh and really isn't that heavy of a lunch compared to the other offerings of the fidi.

The gyro/schwarmas are great and you couldn't ask for a friendlier duo working. I've brought a few coworkers and they've loved it as well.
author: Mitch S.

description: Horrible wrap, no flavor. Just got damn boiled meat with spicy sauce. I would not recommend this place.
author: Karan S.

description: I was not happy with my fallafel. Ingredients were fresh however i did not like how it was prepared. It was made with bare hands/ no gloves and the fallafel was microwaved not deep fried, so it was not crispy. I'm not one to write a bad review however I want to be candid for others to know what they will be getting. I eat a lot of Mediterranean food and I have high expectations for me to rate a place 5 stars
author: Johnny L.

description: Great service. Nice people. Didn't have the full amount and he gave it to me anyway.(was only 28cents short but still nice) food was excellent!! Deserves 5 stars
author: Zach F.

description: Great place to grab a bite. I've been here twice randomly. Each time the owners are so  friendly and take great care of you even though you're only spending maybe $20. The food is flavorful and huge portions. Its not a fancy diner or anything but comfortable and clean. Very fast service too. I recommend it!
author: Tricia K.

description: Service is friendly and super quick. Portions are HUGE. I've had generous portions of sides of gyro which are thick and tasty. Drawbacks are falafel tastes microwaved (not fresh, tough), and pitas are thin and tortilla-like. I would definitely still come back - I've heard friends enjoy the gyro wraps greatly.
author: Tommy W.

description: I had a wonderful gyro meat wrap. Very filling and tasty. Small place right next to boxed foods, and better food
author: Jered M.

description: Fantastic wraps you can ever get! Ordered falafal wraps..low calorie good food..it's a small place though. Owner was very friendly. He helped us figuring out the route and the bus to be taken.
author: Happy P.

description: Good wraps at a decent price. Definitely go for the spicy version, as it adds just the right amount of kick without making you unable to taste anything else.
author: Jonathon V.

description: 0 stars. the falafel smells like baking soda and is all filled with bread...truly nasty
author: Michelle B.

description: Completely messed up my order. Didn't answer phone after calling 3x's.
author: Candice M.

description: Great Mediterranean wraps. Very friendly owner. Reasonable prices. Best for miles around. A+
author: Aman A.
